title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: The New Package Wizard displays a confusing message when no package name is entered. The message implies that a folder corresponding to the package name already exists, causing confusion for users. The issue also mentions the inability to create a default package.
OB: When invoking the New Package Wizard and not entering any package name, a message appears at the top stating "A folder corresponding to the package name already exists."
EB: When invoking the New Package Wizard and not entering any package name, no message should appear at the top of the wizard.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a new Java project.
2. Select the project.
3. Open the New Package Wizard.
